text:
e="preserve">Lee Heung-kam (13 January 1932 – 4 January 2021) was a Hong Kong actress and singer. She was born in Shunde District, Guangdong. Her career began in 1948. Lee was known for her roles in "Story of the White-Haired Demon Girl", "Moonlight Resonance" and "Can't Buy Me Love".
Lee died on 4 January 2021 at a hospital in Hong Kong, aged 88.

annotations.surface_form: Story of the White-Haired Demon Girl
